metadata.title: CVE-2021-3679 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A lack of CPU resource in the Linux kernel tracing module functionality inversions prior to 5.14-rc3 was found in the way user uses trace ring bufferin a specific way. Only privileged local users (with CAP_SYS_ADMINcapability) could use this flaw to starve the resources causing denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-lowlatency - 4.4.0-219.252
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1100-kvm - 4.4.0-1100.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1135.149
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1112-aws - 4.15.0-1112.119~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1109-gcp - 4.15.0-1109.123~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-oracle - 4.15.0-1081.89~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-219.252').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.109').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.149').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.119~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.137~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.123~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.89~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
